Parivadentikā，（f．） [pari+vadento+ikā； vadento being ppr．Caus．of vad] making resound，resounding，in cpd．godhā° “string-resounding，” i．e．a string instrument，lute J．VI，580 （cp．Sk *parivāda an instrument with which the lute is played）．-- Another parivadentikā we find at J．VI，540 （C．reading for T．°vadantikā，with v．l．°devantikā） denoting a kind of bird （ekā sakuṇajāti）．（Page 435）
